bug.short_desc: iframe load event not triggered in IE8

long_desc.thetext:
I've run into an issue where we are using a hidden iframe to trigger a download dialog.
http://tinyurl.com/3wkefjo
We are using a listener on the "load" event of the iframe to detect once the download dialog has appeared and close a widget. This works correctly in all browsers we support except for IE8 where the event handler is never triggered. This only occurs when the immediate contents of the iframe is a resource that prompts the download dialog. I have been able to trigger the event handler by using a dummy html page to redirect to the required resource using the <meta http-equiv="refresh" content=""> tag however this isn't suitable for our needs.
I've included a prototype running in the playground that highlights the difference between IE8 and Firefox/Chrome

I've just realised that the same thing occurs in plain HTML with the following line. I guess I'm looking for another solution then.
<iframe onload="alert('TEST');" src="http://www.oracle.com/us/039762.xls"/>
